analyzed: btsun pa / mthong lags so //

analyzed: padma zhes bya ba ni /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang / klu rnams dang /🔽gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /

original: bla mar byas /
analyzed: bla mar byas /

original: ri mor byas /🔽mchod pa byas te /

original: lha dang / klu @34a *//
analyzed: lha dang / klu @34a *//

translated: He was worshipped and revered by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: He was the Blessed Buddha who had attained the robes, alms-food, bedding, and medicines needed for healing.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du ma byung ba'i snga rol na ni rgyal po gsal rgyal lha gzhan dag la dus gsum du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa rnams kyis rjed par byed do //

translated: Before the Blessed One appeared in the world, King Prasenajit worshipped other gods with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, and ointments three times a day.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung nas ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung nas ni /

analyzed: gzhon nu lta bu'i mdo'i dpes rgyal po gsal rgyal btul nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pa rnyed de /

original: de'i tshe dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas /

analyzed: de nas re zhig na kun dga' ra ba'i srung ma zhig gis me tog padma gsar du byung ba zhig khyer te /

analyzed: kye / mi pha gi padma 'o ni 'tshong ngam zhes dris so // de na re /

analyzed: 'tshong ngo zhes zer ro //

analyzed: des de las rin nyis 'gyur du bskyed nas /

analyzed: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin 'di ni rgod bag can ma yin te /

analyzed: 'di la ni don zhig yod gor ma chag snyam nas /

analyzed: de the tshom skyes te /

analyzed: mu stegs can la dga' ba'i mi de la dris pa /

analyzed: khyod kyis su'i don du 'di ltar skyed par byed /

analyzed: des smras pa /

analyzed: nga ni bcom ldan 'das sred med kyi bu'i phyir skyed par byed do; ;mgon med zas sbyin gyis smras pa /

analyzed: nga ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi don du skyed par byed do //
translated: “I am increasing the amount for the Blessed One, the Buddha.”

original: kun dga' ra ba'i srung mas smras pa /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i srung mas smras pa /
translated: The park keeper asked,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de su yin /

analyzed: thos nas des kyang dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta ba'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs go bskon nas /
translated: Having heard that, he too equipped his four-division army—the elephant division, the cavalry, the chariot division, and the infantry—

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir drangs so //
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir drangs so //
translated: and marched out to do battle with King Ajātaśatru.

original: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgras //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgras //
translated: Then King Ajātaśatru

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs thams cad phrogs te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs thams cad phrogs te /
translated: defeated King Prasenajit of Kosala’s entire army—the elephant division, the cavalry, the chariot division, and the infantry—🔽and captured him.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal pham zhing skrag la rdugs te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal pham zhing skrag la rdugs te /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala was defeated, frightened, and distressed.

original: rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur nas /
translated: He was thoroughly defeated and turned back.

original: shing rta gcig pus mnyan du yod par song ste /
analyzed: shing rta gcig pus mnyan du yod par song ste /
translated: He went to Śrāvastī alone in his chariot.

original: lan gsum gyi bar du'ang de ltar gyur to //
analyzed: lan gsum gyi bar du'ang de ltar gyur to //
translated: This happened three times.

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal mya ngan gyi khang par zhugs nas /🔽lag pa la skom tshugs bcas te /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal mya ngan gyi khang par zhugs nas / lag pa la skom tshugs bcas te /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala entered his sorrow chamber,🔽put his elbows on his knees,

original: sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
analyzed: sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
translated: and sat there with his face in his hands.

original: de nas mnyan du yod pa de na tshong dpon phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: de nas mnyan du yod pa de na tshong dpon phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
translated: At that time in Śrāvastī there lived a certain head merchant who was rich and had great wealth and many possessions.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: He had vast and extensive property,🔽was as wealthy as Vaiśravaṇa,

original: rnam @49a *// thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des /
analyzed: rnam @49a *// thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig 'dug pa des /
translated: and rivaled Vaiśravaṇa’s wealth.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ji ltar pham zhing skrag la rdugs te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ji ltar pham zhing skrag la rdugs te /
translated: He saw that King Prasenajit of Kosala was defeated, frightened, and distressed.

original: rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur nas shing rta gcig pus mnyan du yod par song ngo zhes thos so //
analyzed: rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyis phyogs par gyur nas shing rta gcig pus mnyan du yod par song ngo zhes thos so //
translated: He was utterly defeated and retreated, and now he is alone in Śrāvastī.”

original: thos nas kyang ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ga la ba der song ste phyin pas /🔽rgyal po gsal rgyal la rgyal bar gyur cig /
analyzed: thos nas kyang ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal ga la ba der song ste phyin pas / rgyal po gsal rgyal la rgyal bar gyur cig /
translated: When he heard this, he went to King Prasenajit and,🔽having arrived, praised him, saying, “May the king be victorious!

original: sku tshe ring bar shog cig ces bstod nas /
analyzed: sku tshe ring bar shog cig ces bstod nas /
translated: May he live long!”

original: smras pa / lha; ci'i slad du thugs ngan mdzad /
analyzed: smras pa / lha; ci'i slad du thugs ngan mdzad /
translated: He said, “Your Majesty, why are you so sad?”

original: lha; bdag gis ci tsam gyis na da dung yang lha ji ltar dgyes dgur mdzad par 'gyur ba de tsam gyi gser lha la 'bul bar 'tshal lo zhes byas so //
analyzed: lha; bdag gis ci tsam gyis na da dung yang lha ji ltar dgyes dgur mdzad par 'gyur ba de tsam gyi gser lha la 'bul bar 'tshal lo zhes byas so //
translated: “Your Majesty, I would like to offer you as much gold as you wish, so that you can do whatever you please.”

original: des de la gser gyi phung po chen po spungs te /🔽der mi 'dug pas kyang mi 'greng ba mi mthong la /
analyzed: des de la gser gyi phung po chen po spungs te / der mi 'dug pas kyang mi 'greng ba mi mthong la /
translated: He piled up a great heap of gold for him,🔽and those who were sitting did not see those who were standing,

original: 'greng bas kyang 'dug pa mi mthong ba zhig phul lo //
analyzed: 'greng bas kyang 'dug pa mi mthong ba zhig phul lo //
translated: and those who were standing did not see those who were sitting.

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bdag nyid kyi yul du rtog chen gyi mi kun tu bkye ste /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bdag nyid kyi yul du rtog chen gyi mi kun tu bkye ste /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala sent spies throughout his country,

original: mi de dag ci zer ba nyon cig ces byas so //
analyzed: mi de dag ci zer ba nyon cig ces byas so //
translated: saying, “Listen to what those people are saying!”

original: re zhig na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na rgan po gnyis shig phan tshun gtam zer te /
analyzed: re zhig na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na rgan po gnyis shig phan tshun gtam zer te /
translated: Now in the Jeta Grove two old men were talking to each other.🔽“There is a military strategy called ‘lotus blossom.’

original: padma'i ze ba zhes bya ba'i g-yul gyi dgra thabs yod de; de la mi sngar ma gang yin pa de dag ni g-yul gyi gdong zan du gtong ngo //
analyzed: padma'i ze ba zhes bya ba'i g-yul gyi dgra thabs yod de; de la mi sngar ma gang yin pa de dag ni g-yul gyi gdong zan du gtong ngo //
translated: Those who are the least able are sent to the front of the battle.

original: 'bring gang yin pa de dag ni bar du gzhog go /
analyzed: 'bring gang yin pa de dag ni bar du gzhog go /
translated: Those who are of middling ability are placed in the middle.

original: mi mchog tu dpa' ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyab @49b du gzhog go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi mchog tu dpa' ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyab @49b du gzhog go zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who are the most able and brave are placed in the rear.”

original: de nas de dag gis rgyal po la bsnyad de /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis rgyal po la bsnyad de /
translated: Then they reported this to the king.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis thos nas /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis thos nas /
translated: When King Prasenajit of Kosala heard this,

original: de bzhin du dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi go bskon nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi go bskon nas /
translated: he also arrayed the four divisions of his army

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir drangs so //
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra dang g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir drangs so //
translated: and marched out to do battle with King Ajātaśatru.

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis lus 'phags ma'i bu rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i glang po che'i tshogs thams cad kyang phrogs /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis lus 'phags ma'i bu rgyal po ma skyes dgra'i glang po che'i tshogs thams cad kyang phrogs /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala then defeated the entire army of elephants belonging to Ajatashatru,🔽the son of Vaidehi, the king of Vatsa,

original: rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs kyang phrogs so //
analyzed: rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs kyang phrogs so //
translated: and also defeated his army of cavalry, his army of chariots, and his army of infantry.🔽Ajatashatru, the son of Vaidehi, was defeated, terrified, and distressed.

original: lus 'phags ma'i bu rgyal po ma skyes dgra'ang pham zhing skrag la rdugs te; rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyi ltas par gyur nas gson por bzung ste /
analyzed: lus 'phags ma'i bu rgyal po ma skyes dgra'ang pham zhing skrag la rdugs te; rab tu pham zhing rgyab kyi ltas par gyur nas gson por bzung ste /
translated: He was captured alive

original: shing rta gcig la bskyon nas /
analyzed: shing rta gcig la bskyon nas /
translated: and placed on a single chariot.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to where the Blessed One was,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and upon his arrival he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: While seated to one side,🔽King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa /
translated: “Lord,

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgra 'di ni yun ring po nas bdag gi 'khon zla ma lags par 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / dgra zla ma lags par dgra bgyid pa lags mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgra 'di ni yun ring po nas bdag gi 'khon zla ma lags par 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / dgra zla ma lags par dgra bgyid pa lags mod kyi /
translated: “This King Ajātaśatru has been my enemy for a long time, and he has been my adversary without my being his adversary, and he has been my foe without my being his foe.

original: 'di ni bdag gi grogs po'i bu lags pa'i slad du /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi grogs po'i bu lags pa'i slad du /
translated: But since he is the son of my friend,

original: bdag ni 'di dgum par mi 'tshal te 'di gtang bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di dgum par mi 'tshal te 'di gtang bar 'tshal lo zhes gsol to //
translated: I do not wish to kill him. I wish to spare him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rgyal po chen po @50a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rgyal po chen po @50a *//
translated: The Blessed One said, “Great King,

original: thongs shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: thongs shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: let him go.”

original: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time he spoke in verse:

original: rgyal par gyur na 'khon pa mang //
analyzed: rgyal par gyur na 'khon pa mang //
translated: “When one becomes a king, one has enemies.

original: pham par gyur na sdug bsngal gnas //
analyzed: pham par gyur na sdug bsngal gnas //
translated: When one is defeated, one is in a state of suffering.

original: rgyal dang pham pa spangs na ni //
analyzed: rgyal dang pham pa spangs na ni //
translated: If one abandons victory and defeat,

original: nye bar zhi ste bde bar gnas //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ste bde bar gnas //
translated: one abides in peace and happiness.”

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kośala thought this:

original: bdag gis rgyal srid thob pa 'di ni tshong dpon 'di'i drin yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis rgyal srid thob pa 'di ni tshong dpon 'di'i drin yin gyi /
translated: “I have obtained the kingdom through the kindness of this merchant.

original: bdag gis 'di la ci 'dod pa'i bya dga' sbyin pa'i skabs dbye'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la ci 'dod pa'i bya dga' sbyin pa'i skabs dbye'o snyam mo //
translated: I will give him whatever reward he desires.”

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis tshong dpon de la ci 'dod pa'i bya dga' sbyin pa'i skabs phye na /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis tshong dpon de la ci 'dod pa'i bya dga' sbyin pa'i skabs phye na /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala gave the merchant whatever reward he desired.

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /
translated: He said,

original: bdag ci dga' ba'i bya dga' 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: bdag ci dga' ba'i bya dga' 'tshal gyi /
translated: “I want the reward I desire.

original: bdag zhag bdun gyi bar du ci dga' dgur bgyid pa'i rgyal srid stsol cig ces byas so //
analyzed: bdag zhag bdun gyi bar du ci dga' dgur bgyid pa'i rgyal srid stsol cig ces byas so //
translated: Give me the kingdom for seven days so that I can do whatever I want.”

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bdag gi yul thams cad du dril bsgrags te /
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bdag gi yul thams cad du dril bsgrags te /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala proclaimed with the sound of a conch throughout his realm,

original: nga'i rgyal srid zhag bdun gyi bar du tshong dpon la byin no zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: nga'i rgyal srid zhag bdun gyi bar du tshong dpon la byin no zhes bsgo'o //
translated: “I have given my kingdom to the merchant for seven days.”

original: re zhig na tshong dpon des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams dang / rgyal po gsal rgyal 'khor dang bcas pa zhag bdun gyi bar du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs so //
analyzed: re zhig na tshong dpon des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams dang / rgyal po gsal rgyal 'khor dang bcas pa zhag bdun gyi bar du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs so //
translated: Then the merchant invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks, along with King Prasenajit and his court, for a meal on that day and for seven days.

original: yul ko shi dang / ko sa la na skye bo'i tshogs ji snyed 'khod pa de dag la'ang pho nya btang ste /
analyzed: yul ko shi dang / ko sa la na skye bo'i tshogs ji snyed 'khod pa de dag la'ang pho nya btang ste /
translated: He sent messengers to all the people who lived in the land of Kosala and Koshala.

original: zhag bdun gyi bar du khyed khral thud med par ci dga' dgur 'khod cig /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi bar du khyed khral thud med par ci dga' dgur 'khod cig /
translated: “For seven days you are to be free of taxes and duties. Do whatever you like.

original: bde @50b pa la reg par gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: bde @50b pa la reg par gnas par gyis shig /
translated: Live in comfort.

original: 'dir yang shog la /
analyzed: 'dir yang shog la /
translated: Come here.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su song zhig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su song zhig /
translated: Go for refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: nga'i ston mo'ang tshol la /
analyzed: nga'i ston mo'ang tshol la /
translated: Seek out my festival.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur gyis shig ces byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur gyis shig ces byas nas /
translated: Serve the Tathāgata.”

original: des zhag bdun gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la bkur sti chen pos bkur sti byas so //
analyzed: des zhag bdun gyi bar du bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la bkur sti chen pos bkur sti byas so //
translated: For seven days he served the Blessed One and the community of hearers with great honor.

original: mi 'bum phrag mang po dag kyang bad ba la btsud do //
analyzed: mi 'bum phrag mang po dag kyang bad ba la btsud do //
translated: He also brought many hundreds of thousands of people to the Dharma.

original: zhag bdun lon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te /
analyzed: zhag bdun lon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal te /
translated: After seven days had passed, he bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: sems la ltas par byas nas smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: sems la ltas par byas nas smon lam btab pa /
translated: looked at his mind, and made an aspiration:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su gtong ba 'dis /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su gtong ba 'dis /
translated: by this generation of the thought, by this giving up of the gift-object,🔽may I become a buddha for the blind world, a protector, a refuge,🔽a support, an island,

original: bdag 'jig rten long ba 'dren pa med cing yongs su 'dren pa med par sems can ma brgal ba rnams sgrol ba dang / ma grol ba rnams 'grol ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs 'byin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: bdag 'jig rten long ba 'dren pa med cing yongs su 'dren pa med par sems can ma brgal ba rnams sgrol ba dang / ma grol ba rnams 'grol ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs 'byin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: a lamp, a boat, a bridge, a caravan leader, and a relative.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshong dpon de'i rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshong dpon de'i rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the sequence of causes and the sequence of actions of that merchant, smiled.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang gi tshe 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang gi tshe 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i chos nyid de /
translated: This is the nature of the buddhas, the blessed ones, that🔽when they smile,

original: de'i tshe zhal nas 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / @51a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe zhal nas 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / @51a *//
translated: At that time, blue,

original: dkar po rnams byung nas /
analyzed: dkar po rnams byung nas /
translated: yellow, red, and white light rays come out from his mouth.

original: kha cig ni 'og tu 'gro'o /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'og tu 'gro'o /
translated: Some go below,

original: kha cig ni steng du 'gro'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni steng du 'gro'o //
translated: and some go above.

original: 'og tu 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang /
analyzed: 'og tu 'gro ba gang yin pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang /
translated: Those that go below go to the Reviving Hell, the Black-Lined Hell, the Crushing Hell, the Howling Hell, the Great Howling Hell, the Hot Hell, the Extremely Hot Hell, the Unrelenting Hell,

original: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol dang / so thams thams dang; kyi hud zer dang / aa chu zer dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen por song nas /🔽tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag tu ni bsil bar gyur te 'bab bo //
analyzed: chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol dang / so thams thams dang; kyi hud zer dang / aa chu zer dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen por song nas / tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag tu ni bsil bar gyur te 'bab bo //
translated: the Hell of Blisters, the Hell of Burst Blisters, the Hell of Chattering Teeth, the Hell of Lamentation, the Hell of Moans, the Hell of Utpala-Like Cracks, the Hell of Lotus-Like Cracks, and the Hell of Great Lotus-Like Cracks.🔽In the hot hells, they land and cool them down.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag tu ni dro bar gyur te 'bab bo //
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba gang yin pa de dag tu ni dro bar gyur te 'bab bo //
translated: In the cold hells, they land and warm them up.

original: des na sems can de dag gi gnod pa'i khyad par rnams rtse zhil bar gyur to //
analyzed: des na sems can de dag gi gnod pa'i khyad par rnams rtse zhil bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, the particular torments of those sentient beings were alleviated.

original: de nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, they thought this:

original: kye / ci /
analyzed: kye / ci /
translated: “Hey!

original: bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos sam /
analyzed: bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos sam /
translated: Have we died and transmigrated from here?

original: 'on te gzhan du skyes sam snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du skyes sam snyam mo //
translated: Or have we been born elsewhere?”

original: de nas de dag dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sprul pa 'gyed par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas de dag dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sprul pa 'gyed par mdzad de /
translated: Then, in order to generate faith in them, the Blessed One emanated emanations.

original: de dag gis sprul pa mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag gis sprul pa mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When they saw the emanations, they thought this:

original: kye / bdag cag ni 'di nas kyang shi 'phos par ma gyur la /
analyzed: kye / bdag cag ni 'di nas kyang shi 'phos par ma gyur la /

translated: While they were sitting to one side, the Blessed One taught them the Dharma,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He caused them to take it up,🔽he caused them to rejoice,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and he caused them to be uplifted.

original: chos kyi gtam rnam grangs du mas yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: chos kyi gtam rnam grangs du mas yang dag par bstan /
translated: He taught them the Dharma with many different kinds of explanations,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: he caused them to take it up,🔽he caused them to rejoice,🔽and he caused them to be uplifted.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so //
translated: Then he sat down without speaking.

original: de nas mnyan pa de dag stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas mnyan pa de dag stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the boatmen rose from their seats,🔽put their upper robes over one shoulder,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
translated: and with their right knees on the ground and their palms together they bowed to the Blessed One and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu chu klung khang ldan gyi 'gram du bdag cag gi der sang gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu chu klung khang ldan gyi 'gram du bdag cag gi der sang gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: “Blessed One, please accept our invitation to eat tomorrow at the bank of the river Khagāndhā together with the community of monks.

original: gru zam las kyang bsgral bar 'chel lo zhes gsol na /
analyzed: gru zam las kyang bsgral bar 'chel lo zhes gsol na /
translated: We will also ferry you across the bridge.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mnyan pa rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mnyan pa rnams la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the ferrymen by remaining silent.

original: de nas mnyan pa de dag gis chu klung khang ldan gyi 'gram rdo dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo med par byas te /
analyzed: de nas mnyan pa de dag gis chu klung khang ldan gyi 'gram rdo dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo med par byas te /
translated: Then the ferrymen cleared the banks of the river Kalingī of stones, pebbles, and gravel,

original: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan ni bsgreng /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan ni bsgreng /
translated: raised victory banners and flags,

original: me tog sna @54b tshogs ni gtor /
analyzed: me tog sna @54b tshogs ni gtor /
translated: scattered various flowers,

original: spos kyi snod dag gi nang nas ni bdug pa gsol /
analyzed: spos kyi snod dag gi nang nas ni bdug pa gsol /
translated: burned incense in censers,

original: zhal zas bzang po ni bshams /
analyzed: zhal zas bzang po ni bshams /
translated: prepared fine food,

original: me tog mang po ni sta gon byas so //
analyzed: me tog mang po ni sta gon byas so //
translated: and arranged many flowers.

original: gru zam gyi steng yang me tog gi khang pa dag gis brgyan nas /
analyzed: gru zam gyi steng yang me tog gi khang pa dag gis brgyan nas /
translated: They also decorated the bridge with flower-filled houses.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'phrin gyis bdugs tshod bskul ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'phrin gyis bdugs tshod bskul ba /
translated: They sent a message to the Blessed One, inviting him to the meal:

original: btsun pa / gdugs tshod la bab ste bshos lags na /
analyzed: btsun pa / gdugs tshod la bab ste bshos lags na /
translated: “Honored One, the time has come. The meal is ready.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis da de'i dus la bab par dgongs te gshegs su gsol zhes bskul to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis da de'i dus la bab par dgongs te gshegs su gsol zhes bskul to //
translated: May the Blessed One please consider this to be the right time.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi tshogs kyis zham 'bring byas te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi tshogs kyis zham 'bring byas te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, accompanied by a group of monks,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas mnyan pa'i grong khyer ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas mnyan pa'i grong khyer ga la ba der gshegs te byon nas /
translated: surrounded by the community of monks, went to the city of Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: He sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: de nas mnyan pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bde bar bzhugs par rig nas /🔽rang gi lag nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs so //
analyzed: de nas mnyan pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bde bar bzhugs par rig nas / rang gi lag nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang ma bzang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs so //
translated: Then the people of Śrāvastī, knowing that the community of monks headed by the Buddha had sat down comfortably,🔽with their own hands served and satisfied them with excellent food and delicacies.

original: rang gi lag nas bza' ba dang; bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po rnam grangs du mas tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs nas /
analyzed: rang gi lag nas bza' ba dang; bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po rnam grangs du mas tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs nas /
translated: with their own hands served and satisfied them in various ways with excellent food and delicacies.

original: bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol zin to /🔽gsang sder ni gyu /🔽phyag ni bcabs par rig nas stan ches dma' ba dag khyer te chos mnyan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol zin to / gsang sder ni gyu / phyag ni bcabs par rig nas stan ches dma' ba dag khyer te chos mnyan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Blessed One had finished his meal,🔽and they knew that he had washed his hands and put away his bowl.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: They brought very low seats and sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mnyan pa de dag gi bsam pa dang / @55a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mnyan pa de dag gi bsam pa dang / @55a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, inclinations,🔽nature, and disposition of those listeners,

original: bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of those sailors, gave a teaching on the Dharma that was appropriate for them and that penetrated their minds.

original: de thos pas mnyan pa du mas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: de thos pas mnyan pa du mas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Having heard that teaching, some of the sailors attained the fruit of stream entry.

original: kha cig gis ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Some attained the fruit of once-returner.

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Some attained the fruit of non-returner.

original: kha cig gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Some, having abandoned all defilements, actualized the state of an arhat.

original: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Some generated the intention to attain the awakening of a disciple.

original: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Some generated the intention to attain the awakening of a solitary buddha.

original: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Some generated the intention to attain unsurpassed, complete, and perfect awakening.

original: 'khor de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab pa la bkod do //
analyzed: 'khor de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab pa la bkod do //
translated: He established all those in the retinue in devotion to the Buddha, in the Dharma, and in the Saṅgha.

original: de nas mnyan pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu bkur sti chen po dang ldan pas gru zam las bsgral to //
analyzed: de nas mnyan pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu bkur sti chen po dang ldan pas gru zam las bsgral to //
translated: Then the boatmen ferried the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks across the bridge in a great show of respect.

original: dge slong dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa mthong bas sems dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa mthong bas sems dga' bar gyur te /
translated: The monks were delighted to see the worship of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: They asked the Blessed Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag gang du mdzad lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag gang du mdzad lags /
translated: “Blessed One, where did you perform these roots of virtue?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub @55b pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu tshogs rnyed cing rkyen grub @55b pa dang ldan te /
translated: the Thus-Gone One himself gathered the accumulations and perfected the conditions in other lifetimes.

original: dpa' rgal bzhin du 'byung la /
analyzed: dpa' rgal bzhin du 'byung la /
translated: They are like a flood that comes when the time is right.

original: gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las rnams byas shing bsags te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'ong ba'i las rnams byas shing bsags te /
translated: I have performed and accumulated actions that are certain to come.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di lta bu'i mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di lta bu'i mchod pa byas so //
translated: Thus, they made such offerings to the Tathāgata.

original: dge slong dag; khyed nyan par 'dod dam /
analyzed: dge slong dag; khyed nyan par 'dod dam /
translated: “Bhikṣus, do you wish to hear about it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: nyan par 'tshal lags so //
analyzed: nyan par 'tshal lags so //
translated: we wish to hear it.”

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na / de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: in the past,

original: dgra bcom pa /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: there was a tathāgata, an arhat,

original: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a perfectly awakened one, perfect in wisdom and conduct,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a sugata, a knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unsurpassed guide who tamed beings,

original: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shing rta skal ldan zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shing rta skal ldan zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: a buddha, a bhagavān named Bhadrakalpa­cakravartin.

original: de dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas te ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas te ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa las /
translated: He was attended by sixty-two thousand arhats.

original: gangg'a'i 'gram du byon nas /
analyzed: gangg'a'i 'gram du byon nas /
translated: He went to the bank of the Ganges.

original: de'i che ded dpon zhig 'khor brgya phrag du ma dang gangg'a'i klung las 'gron po dag sgrol zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i che ded dpon zhig 'khor brgya phrag du ma dang gangg'a'i klung las 'gron po dag sgrol zhing 'dug go /
translated: There was a caravan leader who was saving many hundreds of merchants from the Ganges River.

original: phyogs de na cho ma rkun gyi 'jigs pa chen po'ang yod do //
analyzed: phyogs de na cho ma rkun gyi 'jigs pa chen po'ang yod do //
translated: There was also a great danger of robbers in that area.

original: de nas dad dpon gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gi zham ring byas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas dad dpon gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gi zham ring byas pa mthong ngo //
translated: Then the caravan leader saw the Perfectly Awakened One Kal-yandin, attended by sixty-two thousand arhats.

original: mthong nas kyang sems dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang sems dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Having seen him, he was delighted.

original: sems dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: sems dga' bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Being delighted, he requested the Blessed One,

original: bdag gis thog ma kho nar bcom ldan 'das bsgral bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag gis thog ma kho nar bcom ldan 'das bsgral bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I would like to be the first to be saved by the Blessed One.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan @56a *//
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan @56a *//
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kal-yandin

original: gyis kyang ded dpon la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: gyis kyang ded dpon la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: also gave his consent to the caravan leader by remaining silent.

original: de nas ded dpon des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas pa 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pas gru zam las bsgral te /
analyzed: de nas ded dpon des yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas pa 'byor pa chen po dang ldan pas gru zam las bsgral te /
translated: Then the captain, with great wealth, crossed the river by boat and bridge,

original: zhal zas bzang pos kyang tshim par byas nas /
analyzed: zhal zas bzang pos kyang tshim par byas nas /
translated: and satisfied the Perfectly Awakened One Śreyasāṃgata and his retinue of sixty-two thousand arhats with good food.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab bo //
translated: He made a prayer for unexcelled, total, and complete enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: khyed ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: khyed ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nga yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nga yin te /
translated: The one who was the captain then is now me.

original: ngas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas pa /
analyzed: ngas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shing rta skal ldan dgra bcom pa drug khri nyis stong gis zham ring byas pa /
translated: I satisfied the Perfectly Awakened One Śreyasāṃgata and his retinue of sixty-two thousand arhats

original: gru zam las bsgral ba dang / zhal zas bzang pos tshim par byas pa dang / smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ngas 'khor ba na bde ba chen po mtha' yas pa nyams su myong la /
analyzed: gru zam las bsgral ba dang / zhal zas bzang pos tshim par byas pa dang / smon lam btab pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ngas 'khor ba na bde ba chen po mtha' yas pa nyams su myong la /
translated: As a result of that action, I experienced infinite great happiness in saṃsāra.

original: da ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na'ang 'di lta bu'i mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: da ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na'ang 'di lta bu'i mchod pa byas so //
translated: And now, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they have made such offerings to me.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: de bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /🔽ston pa la bkur stir bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste / ston pa la bkur stir bya'o //
translated: therefore you should train thinking,🔽‘We will respect the Teacher,🔽we will honor him,

original: bla mar bya'o //🔽ri mor bya'o //
analyzed: bla mar bya'o // ri mor bya'o //
translated: we will venerate him,

original: mchod pa bya'o //🔽ston pa la bkur stir byas /🔽bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /
analyzed: mchod pa bya'o // ston pa la bkur stir byas / bla mar byas / ri mor byas /
translated: we will make offerings to him,🔽and we will rely on the Teacher, respect him, honor him, venerate him, and make offerings to him.’

original: mchod pa byas nas brten te gnas par bya'o zhes dge slong khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas brten te gnas par bya'o zhes dge slong khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, you should train in that way.”

original: bcom ldan @56b 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan @56b 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Bhagavān having said that,

original: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
analyzed: dge slong de dag yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do ////
translated: The monks rejoiced in and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: ka ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang; klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang /🔽lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
analyzed: ka ba zhes bya ba ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la rgyal po rnams dang / blon po chen po rnams dang / phyug po rnams dang / pho brang 'khor gyi mi rnams dang / tshong dpon rnams dang / ded dpon rnams dang / lha rnams dang; klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /
translated: The Pillar🔽The Blessed Buddha was honored, revered, esteemed, and venerated by kings, great ministers, wealthy people, city-dwellers, guild masters, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas,

original: bla mar byas; ri mor byas /🔽mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: bla mar byas; ri mor byas /🔽mchod pa byas te /
translated: asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He was the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one endowed with wisdom and action, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unexcelled charioteer of those who need to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Lord, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
analyzed: na bza' dang / zhal zas dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / snyun gsos dang / sman zong rnams brnyes pa /
translated: He had attained the excellent robes, food, bedding, seat, remedies for sickness, and necessary utensils.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa /
